definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: But there is more to writing a good cover letter.
sentences.chinese: 但是想要写出一封精彩的求职信远没有这么简单。

sentences.english: The unemployed engineer wrote a dozen applications for jobs but go nothing.
sentences.chinese: 失业的工程师一连写了十几封求职信，但一无所获。

sentences.english: May I submit a cover letter, addressed to a specific individual, with my resume?
sentences.chinese: 我可以将我的求职信和简历一起发给一个指定的人吗？

sentences.english: The cover letter is often neglected or concocted out of standard phrases.
sentences.chinese: 求职信京常被忽视，或者由一些标准片段组成。

sentences.english: Some say physical appearance matters even more to employers than a cover letter.
sentences.chinese: 有些研究称相貌对雇主来说甚至比求职信还重要。

sentences.english: Use your own words, your letter should sound like you.
sentences.chinese: 使用自己的语言，让你的求职信文如其人。

sentences.english: Avoid setting off the "overqualified" alarm bells with your resume and cover letter.
sentences.chinese: 不要在简历和求职信中发布“条件太高”的警报。

sentences.english: Dear manager I learned from the newspaper that your company wanted to hire an English translator.
sentences.chinese: 公司翻译职位而给该公司经理写的一份英文求职信。

sentences.english: Keep a copy of the cover letter for your records.
sentences.chinese: 自己留一份求职信的副本。

sentences.english: Sign the cover letter with a blue or black ink pen.
sentences.chinese: 用蓝色或黑色水笔在求职信上签名。

sentences.english: And have at least three people proofread your resume and cover letter.
sentences.chinese: 至少要有三个人检查你的简历和求职信。

sentences.english: Thanks very much for reading my resume.
sentences.chinese: 非常感谢您能够呈阅我的求职信。

sentences.english: I have receive your letter and your resume.
sentences.chinese: 我已经收了您的求职信和履历表。

sentences.english: Don't just use a general template for your cover letter and revery company.
sentences.chinese: 不要只给每家公司的求职信和简历用一个通用模板。

sentences.english: We have been deluged with applications for the job.
sentences.chinese: 申请这个工作的求职信使我们应接不暇。

sentences.english: Never submit a generic, one-size-fits-all resume or cover letter.
sentences.chinese: 永远不要发送一封大众化的通用简历或求职信。

definition: to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
applied writing/writing for practical purposes (business letters, advertising etc)
(coll.) to cultivate good relations with sb/to try to gain favor with sb
